content: Great game! Love the simplicity in rules but variation in each game. The flavor text is great too. One question though, is there a way to see high scores? That would be nice, although I'm scared to see how many games I've played already ðŸ˜‚

Tutorial really needs to be improved. For having to pay for a game upfront without testing to see if it's worth it. Your not making the cut. I could waist the time to figure out what the hell is going on. But there's a lot of OTHER games that are explained well upfront before any purchases. So I'd consider this game to be hostile for this reason.
There was no tutorial on how to play the game

Great games, lots of replayability. It could use better instructions perhaps with illustrations to better show the finer points of scoring. Item adjacency was a bit of a puzzle also(for a while I thought it had to just be the same color item) and it took me a while to understand exactly when you could place a card. A feature that would be nice is to be able and choose the other card if you made a mistake selecting the right one to place.I backed the Kickstarter for this and look forward to it.

A very solid digital card game! Some of the controls are a bit fiddley (mostly switching back and forth between the adventure card and the backpack), and it could really use a back button In case you accidentally tap on the wrong loot card, but none of that really interferes with the fun.
Great quick microgame. I hope you bring the 18 other heroes from Squire pack 1.
Lots of fun to play! I'm terrible at it, but the games are so quick that it's fine to lose and start a new game. :D

Just as amazing as the physical game, but without the need to count your own score, which has revealed two things; 1 my maths is clearly atrocious, and 2 I'm not as good at this game as I used to believe I was
